title: Tiger the Competitor
sub_head: However Woods finishes at the Masters, how can one not admire the comeback?
body:
Your humble correspondent is not a golfer but has to stand up and cheer when a 45-year-old accident victim with multiple leg fractures manages to avoid amputation and about a year later is threatening to make the cut at the Masters.
Tiger Woods, now 46, is having a rough start on Friday at Augusta National Golf Club as he grinds his way through the second round of the sport’s most celebrated tournament. But to be contending at all at this year’s event seems almost miraculous and would be impossible without a raging competitive fire.
